quiz.question: Which description fits the myth about superfoods?
options: One food can provide all needed nutrients
Some foods are nutrient-rich, but no single superfood prevents disease alone
Superfoods always reverse chronic illness
quiz.answer: Some foods are nutrient-rich, but no single superfood prevents disease alone

quiz.question: Which claim about gargling salt water preventing colds matches evidence?
options: Gargling salt water prevents viruses from causing colds
Gargling may soothe throat symptoms but does not prevent viral infection
Gargling sterilizes the entire respiratory tract
quiz.answer: Gargling may soothe throat symptoms but does not prevent viral infection

quiz.question: Which statistical observation comes from meta-analyses of homeopathy trials?
options: Many rigorous trials show effects consistent with placebo rather than specific efficacy
Meta-analyses prove homeopathy cures infectious diseases reliably
Homeopathy outperforms antibiotics in randomized trials
quiz.answer: Many rigorous trials show effects consistent with placebo rather than specific efficacy

quiz.question: Which statement about spot reduction of fat through exercise is accurate?
options: Doing many sit-ups removes belly fat specifically
Fat loss occurs across the body; spot reduction is ineffective
Targeted exercises destroy fat cells in that area only
quiz.answer: Fat loss occurs across the body; spot reduction is ineffective

quiz.question: Which origin explains the carrot-night vision myth from World War II?
options: British propaganda credited carrots to hide radar technology
German pilots invented the carrot myth intentionally
Carrots were scientifically proven to grant night vision instantly
quiz.answer: British propaganda credited carrots to hide radar technology

quiz.question: Which regulatory fact reflects claims about colloidal silver promoted historically?
options: Colloidal silver was once marketed as a cure but can cause argyria and lacks proven benefits
Colloidal silver is FDA-approved to treat infections
Colloidal silver is a mandatory hospital antiseptic
quiz.answer: Colloidal silver was once marketed as a cure but can cause argyria and lacks proven benefits

quiz.question: Which claim about drinking eight glasses of water daily is most accurate?
options: Everyone needs exactly eight glasses daily
Hydration needs vary by person and activity
Eight glasses prevent all health problems
quiz.answer: Hydration needs vary by person and activity

quiz.question: Which conclusion about ear candling aligns with safety advisories?
options: Ear candling effectively removes earwax safely
Regulators warn ear candling risks burns and ear damage
Ear candling is medically recommended for ear infections
quiz.answer: Regulators warn ear candling risks burns and ear damage

quiz.question: Which nuanced conclusion comes from studies on mindfulness and placebo-like effects?
options: Mindfulness-based interventions improve symptoms partly via attention, expectation, and neuroplastic changes
Mindfulness has no measurable effects on the brain
Mindfulness instantly cures all psychiatric disorders
quiz.answer: Mindfulness-based interventions improve symptoms partly via attention, expectation, and neuroplastic changes

quiz.question: Which statement about green juices detoxifying the body is correct?
options: Green juices remove all bodily toxins overnight
Juices provide nutrients but organs remove toxins naturally
Green juice replaces all meals safely forever
quiz.answer: Juices provide nutrients but organs remove toxins naturally

quiz.question: Which statement about herbal supplements and standardization is true?
options: All herbal supplements have consistent active ingredient levels
Herbal supplement potency varies without strict regulation in many regions
Herbal supplements are identical to prescription drugs
quiz.answer: Herbal supplement potency varies without strict regulation in many regions

quiz.question: Which documented effect links high-dose vitamin A supplements to risks in certain populations?
options: Excess vitamin A in pregnancy increases birth defect risks
High vitamin A has no known risks
Vitamin A prevents all congenital anomalies
quiz.answer: Excess vitamin A in pregnancy increases birth defect risks

quiz.question: Which statement about cracking knuckles is correct?
options: Cracking knuckles causes arthritis
Cracking knuckles does not cause arthritis
Cracking knuckles prevents arthritis
quiz.answer: Cracking knuckles does not cause arthritis

quiz.question: Which claim about fluoride and IQ is supported by major health authorities?
options: Community water fluoridation at recommended levels causes major IQ loss
Major health agencies find recommended fluoridation safe; high exposures may have risks
Fluoride instantly corrupts brain cells at low doses
quiz.answer: Major health agencies find recommended fluoridation safe; high exposures may have risks

quiz.question: Which specific mechanism explains how tobacco smoke impacts cardiovascular risk?
options: Tobacco smoke promotes inflammation, endothelial dysfunction, and atherosclerosis
Tobacco smoke only affects lungs and not the cardiovascular system
Smoking strengthens arterial walls
quiz.answer: Tobacco smoke promotes inflammation, endothelial dysfunction, and atherosclerosis
